str2: A primary particle; but, and, etc.
Paul, Paulus. Of Latin origin; Paulus, the name of a Roman and of an apostle.

parse: Verb - Aorist Participle Middle - Genitive Masculine Singular
str2: (a) To call (name) by a supplementary (additional, alternative) name, (b) mid: To call upon, appeal to, address.
From teros; to guard, i.e. To note; by implication, to detain; by extension, to withhold; by extension, to withhold.
A primary preposition; to or into, of place, time, or purpose; also in adverbial phrases.
The, the definite article. Including the feminine he, and the neuter to in all their inflections; the definite article; the.
Judicial examination, decision; an act of discernment. From diaginosko; examination.
The, the definite article. Including the feminine he, and the neuter to in all their inflections; the definite article; the.
From sebazomai; venerable, i.e. a title of the Roman Emperor, or imperial.

parse: Verb - Aorist Indicative Active - 1st Person Singular
str2: To command, order, direct, bid. From a primary kello; 'hail'; to incite by word, i.e. Order.

parse: Personal / Possessive Pronoun - Accusative Masculine 3rd Person Singular
str2: He, she, it, they, them, same. From the particle au; the reflexive pronoun self, used of the third person, and of the other persons.

str2: From teros; to guard, i.e. To note; by implication, to detain; by extension, to withhold; by extension, to withhold.
A conjunction, preposition and adverb of continuance, until.

parse: Verb - Aorist Subjunctive Active - 1st Person Singular
str2: To send up (to a higher tribunal), send back. From ana and pempo; to send up or back.

str2: He, she, it, they, them, same. From the particle au; the reflexive pronoun self, used of the third person, and of the other persons.
To, towards, with. A strengthened form of pro; a preposition of direction; forward to, i.e. Toward.
Of Latin origin; Caesar, a title of the Roman emperor.
